body.p: Which of the following best describes the purpose of a packet checksum?

multiple_choice.choice: Checksums detect whether bytes were corrupted in transit.
Checksums compress sent bytes so they take up less space.
Checksums encrypt bytes on the wire so they cannot be read by others.
Checksums speed access to frequently used bytes.

response.feedback: Sometimes bits are corrupted during transmission, and the checksum helps the recipient detect the corruption.
Checksums are about error detection, not compression.
Checksums are about error detection, not encryption.
Checksums are about error detection, not speeding up access.
